subject: Programming
title: Supply Chain Security
description: A quick, practical guide to Supply Chain Security.

hook.text: A single compromised open source package can infect thousands of applications downstream.

buildup.text: The SolarWinds and Log4Shell incidents showed that software supply chains are dangerously fragile.

discovery.text: Attackers target small, trusted packages because they know downstream projects blindly trust updates.

twist.text: We demand security from open source but rarely fund the maintainers who provide it.

climax.text: Governments and corporations now invest in supply chain security. The wake-up call was expensive.

punchline.text: Trust without verification is a vulnerability.

quiz.question: What did Log4Shell reveal about open source?
options: Software supply chains are dangerously fragile
